post_addresses.title: Corporation Tax Services
post_addresses.description:
Write to HMRC for help with general Corporation Tax enquiries.

You don’t need to include a street name, city name or PO box when writing to this address.

Couriers should use a different address.

phone_numbers.title: Corporation Tax Helpline
phone_numbers.description:
Call HMRC for help with general Corporation Tax enquiries.

You’ll need your 10 digit Unique Tax Reference when you call.

Our advisers cannot give you this reference over the phone. You can get your UTR:

  • from your agent
  • on letters from HMRC
  • online (sign in using Government Gateway)

If you cannot find your UTR you can ask for a copy for your Corporation Tax UTR.
phone_numbers.open_hours:
Monday to Friday: 8am to 6pm

Closed weekends.
phone_numbers.best_time_to_call: Phone lines may be less busy between 8am to 9am and 5pm to 6pm.

contact_form_links.title: Get your National Insurance number
contact_form_links.description:
If you’ve lost or forgotten your National Insurance number, or need a letter confirming it, you can:

  • register for or log in to your personal tax account to view or download, print, save or share a letter with it on
  • fill in the online form and post it to us, if you’re unable to register for a personal tax account

You can also find your National Insurance number on your payslip, P60, tax returns or official letters about tax, pensions or benefits.

contact_form_links.title: Tell HMRC about changes that could affect your tax code
contact_form_links.description:
This service is part of the personal tax account, and you can use it to check:

  • your tax code
  • the information HMRC holds about your employment
  • an estimate of how much tax you’ll pay

contact_form_links.title: Tell HMRC you've changed name or address
Use HMRC’s automated assistant Ask Ruth

post_addresses.title: Pay As You Earn and Self Assessment
post_addresses.description:
Write to HMRC at this address for all Income Tax queries except complaints.

You don’t need to include a street name, city name or PO box when writing to this address.

Couriers should use a different address.

phone_numbers.title: Income Tax
phone_numbers.description:
Call HMRC for help with questions about Income Tax and Class 4 National Insurance, including issues with:

  • your tax code
  • tax overpayments or underpayments
  • P800 tax calculations

You can also get help with identification and verification problems if you’re trying to register for a personal tax account.

Have your National Insurance number with you when you phone.
phone_numbers.open_hours:
Monday to Friday: 8am to 8pm
Saturday: 8am to 4pm
Sunday: 9am to 5pm

Closed bank holidays and Easter Sunday.
phone_numbers.best_time_to_call:
Phone lines are less busy before 10am, Monday to Friday and on Sundays.

HMRC may ask if you want to add voice identification to your account. You can find out more in the Voice Identification Privacy Notice.

phone_numbers.title: Marriage Allowance
phone_numbers.description:
Call HMRC to:

  • make a backdated claim for Marriage Allowance if your spouse or civil partner has died
  • apply for Marriage Allowance if you do not have a National Insurance number, because you do not intend to work or study in the UK
phone_numbers.open_hours:
Monday to Friday: 8am to 8pm
Saturday: 8am to 4pm
Sunday: 9am to 5pm

Closed bank holidays and Easter Sunday.

HMRC can only discuss your claim with you or someone you have authorised as your representative. A partner or someone else can get general advice but they must be authorised to discuss a claim with the helpline.

children.description: Contact HMRC if you haven't received your National Insurance number or have lost or forgotten it
children.title: National Insurance numbers

details.description: Contact HMRC if you haven't received your National Insurance number or have lost or forgotten it
details.title: National Insurance numbers

contact_form_links.title: Get your National Insurance number
contact_form_links.description:
If you’ve lost or forgotten your National Insurance number, or need a letter confirming it, you can:

  • register for or log in to your personal tax account to view or download, print, save or share a letter with it on
  • fill in the online form and post it to us, if you’re unable to register for a personal tax account

You can also find your National Insurance number on your payslip, P60, tax returns or official letters about tax, pensions or benefits.

phone_numbers.title: National Insurance numbers
phone_numbers.description:
Call to get advice if:

  • you’re over 15 years and 9 months and 20 years old and haven’t received a National Insurance number
  • you cannot register for a new personal tax account to view your National Insurance number or print the confirmation letter.
  • you’re over 20 years old and haven’t got a National Insurance number Apply for a National Insurance number

HMRC won’t tell you your National Insurance number over the phone. They’ll post it to you and it’ll arrive within 15 working days.
phone_numbers.open_hours:
Monday to Friday: 8am to 8pm
Saturday: 8am to 4pm

Closed Sundays and bank holidays.

details.title: Shares and assets valuation

post_addresses.title: Shares and Assets Valuation
post_addresses.description:
Write to HMRC about the valuation of unquoted shares and other assets.

You don’t need to include a street name, city name or PO box when writing to this address.

phone_numbers.title: Shares and Assets Valuation enquiry line
phone_numbers.description:
Phone HMRC to get advice about:

  • unquoted shares (shares of companies which are not quoted, listed or traded on the stock exchange)
  • intangible assets (for example intellectual property, trademarks, patents, goodwill)
  • foreign shares
  • bloodstock
  • chattels
  • foreign residential property
  • boats, aircraft and a range of other assets
phone_numbers.open_hours:
Monday to Friday: 8am to 4pm

Closed weekends and bank holidays.

children.description: Email, call or write to HMRC to report a scheme that you think has been set up to avoid tax
children.title: Report tax avoidance schemes

details.description: Email, call or write to HMRC to report a scheme that you think has been set up to avoid tax
details.title: Report tax avoidance schemes

post_addresses.title: HM Revenue and Customs
post_addresses.street_address:
Counter-Avoidance
Risk, Information, Governance and Support SO483
post_addresses.description:
Write to HMRC to report a tax avoidance scheme (or tax arrangements) that you know about. If you’ve received any promotional material about a tax avoidance scheme, you can also send that to us.

You do not need to include a street name or PO box. HMRC will not reply to confirm they’ve received your letter.

Couriers should use a different address.

email_addresses.title: Email HMRC to report a tax avoidance scheme (sometimes known as tax arrangements) that you know about:
email_addresses.description:
If you’ve received any emails or promotional material about a tax avoidance scheme, you can forward them to us at this email address.

Do not send any personal information by email, as we cannot reply to you or deal with any questions about your tax. Emails sent over the internet may be intercepted by someone else, so your personal information may not be secure.

phone_numbers.title: Counter-Avoidance Intelligence Team
phone_numbers.description: Call HMRC to report a tax avoidance scheme (or tax arrangements) that you know about.
phone_numbers.open_hours:
Monday to Friday: 9am to 5pm

Closed weekends and bank holidays.

details.description: Use the online forms or call HMRC for help with filing your Self Assessment tax return online, or if you've lost your Government Gateway user ID and password
details.title: Self Assessment: online services

contact_form_links.title: Get help with problems signing in
contact_form_links.description:
Find out what to do if you’ve lost your:

  • user ID
  • password
  • activation code

You can complete Self Assessment as an individual online using GOV.UK Verify if you do not want to wait for replacement details to be sent to you.
It will take about 10 minutes to verify your identity.

phone_numbers.title: Online Services Helpdesk
phone_numbers.description:
Get help with:

  • problems logging on or registering for an online service
  • problems submitting forms
  • error messages in your online account or on HMRC forms
  • downloading and using HMRC free software and tools

Have your HMRC Unique Taxpayer Reference (UTR) number with you when you call.

Contact the Self Assessment Helpline if you have a question about how to fill in a tax return.
phone_numbers.open_hours:

Saturday: 8am to 4pm
Sunday: 9am to 5pm

Closed bank holidays, Easter Sunday, Christmas Day, Boxing Day and New Year’s Day.

organisations.description: We are the UK’s tax, payments and customs authority, and we have a vital purpose: we collect the money that pays for the UK’s public services and help families and individuals with targeted financial support. We do this by being impartial and increasingly effective and efficient in our administration. We help the honest majority to get their tax right and make it hard for the dishonest minority to cheat the system. HMRC is a non-ministerial department, supported by 2 agencies and public bodies .
